page.title: 18GEOLOGY
page.content: THE BLOCK JUST COVERS THE SOUTH EASTERN EDGE OF THE CHILTERN HILLS, WHICH ARE A RANGE OF CHALK UPLANDS RISING TO APPROXIMATELY 265 METRES AT THE HIGHEST POINT.THE RIVER CHESS AND GADE HOWEVER,BOTH OCCUPY NARROW VALES OF ALUVIUM AND JOIN AT A POINT JUST SOUTH OF THIS AREA IN RICKMANSWORTH TO MAKE A 'V' SHAPE. LAND IN BETWEEN THE VALES IS IN GEOLOGICAL TERMS UPPER CHALK (50 TO 60 METRES)AND GLACIAL GRAVEL (UP TP 106 METRES). TO LOOK AT,THE UPPER CHALK IS A SOFT WHITE MATERIAL WITH MANY FLINTS AND THE GLACIAL GRAVEL IS A FINE MIXTURE OF STONES AND SOME BOULDERS.
